result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keon L Hicks

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keon L Hicks appeared by video.  Attorney J. Hall  on behalf of Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Keon L Hicks.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Hermann. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Imposed and stayed bench warrant is cancelled. Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Keon L Hicks not in court.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Keon L Hicks.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant does not appear. Defense Counsel informs that court that the defendant is in the hospital and unable to appear. Bench Warrant is issued but STAYED. Court is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-16-2022

Defendant Keon L Hicks in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Keon L Hicks appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Case adjourned due to State's request as the witness could not appear. Witness was serving a Search Warrant. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD
Received and Filed; forwarded to Judge for review
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered no contact with co-def:  James Moody;  Jakwan H; and 1319 West North Avenue, 24/7 Gas Station

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered co-defs kept separate while in custody.

ADDRESS INFO for Keon L Hicks
Current: 2643 North 1st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212   (Effective: 08-01-2022)
Prior: 2633 North 1st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212

Defendant Keon L Hicks in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Keon L Hicks in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keon L Hicks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
